name: numth2

stmt.origin: mpbi(wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))

body.origin:
|- wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0))
-| wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd))
-| wb(wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)), wrex(s0, con0, wbr(cv(s0), cen, c0)))
body.pretty:
⊢ ∃(s0 ∈ On, s0[≅]c0)
⊣ c0 ∈ dom(card)
⊣ (c0 ∈ dom(card)↔ ∃(s0 ∈ On, s0[≅]c0))

cumulated.pretty:

⊣ c0 ∈ dom(card)
⊣ (c0 ∈ dom(card)↔ ∃(s0 ∈ On, s0[≅]c0))

body.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd))
-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ dom(card)
⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌
⊣ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 → c0 ∈ dom(card))

-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c0, cdm(ccrd)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ ∃(s0 ∈ On, s0[≅]c0)
⊣ (c0 ∈ dom(card)↔ ∃(s0 ∈ On, s0[≅]c0))
⊣ c0 ∈ 𝕌

comment: Numeration theorem: any set is equinumerous to some ordinal (using AC). Theorem 10.3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 84. (Contributed by NM, 20-Oct-2003.)
